cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles southeast of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the east-central Gulf of Mexico, then turning slightly north and aiming for the central-eastern Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon/Morgan City area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cameron, LA to west of Intracoastal City, LA and from the Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cameron, LA to west of Intracoastal City, LA and from the Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf coast from the TX/LA border eastward to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) possible Sunday afternoon through early Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible from Sabine Pass to Pecan Island, with water funneling into Calcasieu Lake/Ship Channel
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of heavy rain possible, with localized higher amounts causing flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents; prolonged power outages and facility access issues likely
